course.subject: LANG
course.name: Technical Communication II for ECE & CPEG
course.description: A one-term, major-specific language course for all ECE students and for all CPEG students undertaking an ECE Final Year Project. The course focuses on Final Year Project report writing and presentations and communication in professional contexts relevant to ECE and CPEG.
course.prerequisites: (For DDP only) CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1003 (Prior to 2022-23); (For all others) LANG 2030
course.corequisites: ELEC 4900 OR ELEC 4901 OR ELEC 4910 OR CPEG 4910 OR CPEG 4911 OR CPEG 4912

reviews.author: AceOfSpades
reviews.title: Course is fine, but the lecturer is excellent!
reviews.comment_content:
LANG 4031 is a three-credit course offered to final year students from ECE and to CPEG students taking an ECE FYP. Over one semester, students will attend three hours of class and will be expected to complete up to six hours of out-of-class work, per week. The course focuses on two areas:

Part 1: Communication in Professional Contexts In the workplace, engineers often have to communicate with mixed audiences of other engineers and business people. In this part of the course, you will focus on talking and writing about technology to mixed audiences.

Part 2: Communication skills for ECE projects You will enhance your ability to write and speak about academic projects in ECE,  focusing on your ECE Final Year Project . In this part of the course you will focus on communicating with an academic audience.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I was initially taught by Eric, but I switched to Angie because of time clashes with other courses.

Having worked in engineering-related companies for many years, Eric is an experienced lecturer. However, he has a slightly slow pace of teaching.

Angie is an excellent lecturer as she explains everything relevant to us very clearly. I remembered her being the instructor of the workshop group back in HUMA1000F in 2019-20 Spring, though I did not preform well in humanity subjects. She is responsible for the lectures and would reply to our e-mails, answering our questions as well as providing personal feedback to our assignments for us to improve ourselves. Just be proactive and try to ask her anything you don't understand, and she'll try to answer your question in a timely manner.

She also has a keen sense of time management, being able to finish the teaching ahead of every assignment ahead of time. Students can have ample time to complete the assignments or consult with her in case we have any difficulties.

Angie pays a lot of attention to how much time and effort is put into the LANG course, so you do not want to be late for attendance. If you attend all her lectures and remember everything that was discussed in her lectures, it's hard to fail.

By the way, you need to assume you're going for a real interview in the first spoken assessment. In other words, you can get bonus points if you wear a suit and take off you mask while taking the video presentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 speaking assessments and 2 writing assessments throughout the semester:

1. Presenting industry trends and future developments, 4 minutes in video format, 20% of total LANG 4031 grade
2. Technology blog post, 700 - 1000 words, 25% of total LANG 4031 grade
3. Peer review of presentation, 5% of total LANG 4031 grade
4. Introduction and Literature Review to an ECE project report, 1000-1300 words, 25% of total LANG 4031 grade
5. Poster presentation, 5 minutes (individual) or 8 minutes (group), poster in electronic format and needs to follow the template from your department, 25% of total LANG 4031 grade
reviews.comment_workload:
Although there's a course schedule in Canvas, Angie does not strictly follow it and has her own teaching plan. Frankly speaking, that schedule of hers was miles better. It really helped lessen our workload and gave us an extra week to complete each assignment or consult her instead of the intended one week according to the official schedule.

As she said, communication is important. Let her know if you have any midterms coming and she'll try to rearrange the lessons. I find it very flexible and manageable this way.

reviews.comment_content:
The whole course is about presenting technical ideas in different contexts. This includes written and spoken, in business and academic settings.

Quite helpful for the final year project.
reviews.comment_teaching: Laid back lessons. Bruce Ma is a good instructor as he speak no bullshit. Materials and sample papers provided are practical and useful for writing technical reports.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade from 2 Presentations and 2 short essays. (1000 words or something?) No midterm exam, no final exam.

Very good grades
reviews.comment_workload: 2 Presentations and 2 short essays. That is almost 0 workload. I worked on the essays and presentations a day before deadline and my grade still went very well. The key is to stay attentive in class and respect everyone.
